title: Talos Scan not accepting simple list or tuples
body:
#### 1) Confirm the below

Confirmed, my problem looks too simple to be there 

#### 2) Include the output of:

(MLKeras) C:\Users\valera>pip show talos
Name: talos
Version: 1.0
Summary: Talos Hyperparameter Tuning for Keras
Home-page: http://autonom.io
Author: Mikko Kotila
Author-email: mailme@mikkokotila.com
License: MIT
Location: d:\programs\anaconda3\envs\mlkeras\lib\site-packages
Requires: pandas, requests, numpy, statsmodels, tqdm, chances, astetik, kerasplotlib, tensorflow, sklearn, wrangle
Required-by:

#### 3) Explain clearly what you are trying to achieve

Im trying to run Scan. My model works as a standalone Keras model but hyperparameter search is needed.


#### 4) Explain what you have already tried

Defining the params dictionary in several ways, converting the argument to int, none works.

#### 5) Provide a code-complete reference

- [ x] My support question includes an input model
- [x ] My support question includes a parameter dictionary
- [ x] My support question includes a `Scan()` command
- [x] My support question includes a link to a sample of the data

My model looks simple enough but I can't make scan work, it seems like the list iterator is not working.

My jupyter notebook:
https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1Vkai1Gd36Koc4F0O2umU8ckeqR7H4uKB?usp=sharing

example data to use:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ib7YsX7fQnzGHFZo-VGVDoJKehJIuIYS/view?usp=sharing

The error I get is the following:


---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-46-7fa953e2320f> in <module>
----> 1 t = talos.Scan(x=tr_X,y=tr_y,model=ann_model(tr_X,tr_y,pr_X,pr_y,p),grid_downsample=.1,params=p)
      2 #t = talos.Scan(x=np.array(tr_X),y=np.array(tr_y),model=ann_model,params=p,experiment_name='1')

<ipython-input-29-bd2dee4f2ef5> in ann_model(x_train, y_train, x_val, y_val, params)
      4     init = p['init']
      5 
----> 6     neuron_1 = int(p['first_neuron'])
      7     neuron_2 = int(p['second_neuron'])
      8 

TypeError: int() argument must be a string, a bytes-like object or a number, not 'list'




Thanks.

---
